NotRestoredReasons.summary: NOTE Experimental The NotRestoredReasons interface of the {{domxref("Performance API", "Performance API", "", "nocode")}} provides report data containing reasons why the current document was blocked from using the back/forward cache (bfcache) on navigation.

remarks.para: These objects are accessed via the property.

NotRestoredReasonsUrl.summary:
NOTE Experimental The url read-only property of the
interface returns a string representing the URL of the navigated page or {{htmlelement("iframe")}}.
NotRestoredReasonsUrl.value: A string.If the document is in a cross-origin <iframe>, url will return null.

NotRestoredReasonsReasons.summary:
NOTE Experimental The reasons read-only property of the
interface returns an array of objects, each representing a reason why the navigated page was blocked from using the back/forward cache ({{Glossary("bfcache")}}).
NotRestoredReasonsReasons.value: An array of objects. See Blocking reasons for a list of the possible blocking reasons.If the document is in a cross-origin iframe, reasons will return null, but the parent document may show a reason of "masked" if any <iframe>s blocked bfcache usage for the top-level frame.

NotRestoredReasonsSrc.summary:
NOTE Experimental The src read-only property of the
interface returns a string representing the path to the source of the {{htmlelement("iframe")}} the document is contained in (for example <iframe src="b.html">).
NotRestoredReasonsSrc.value: A string.If the document is not in an <iframe>, src will return null.

NotRestoredReasonsName.summary:
NOTE Experimental The name read-only property of the
interface returns a string representing the name attribute value of the iframe the document is contained in (for example <iframe name="bar" src="...">).
NotRestoredReasonsName.value: A string.If the document is not in an <iframe> or the <iframe> has no name set, name will return null.

NotRestoredReasonsChildren.summary:
NOTE Experimental The children read-only property of the
interface returns an array of objects, one for each child {{htmlelement("iframe")}} embedded in the current document, which may contain reasons why the top-level frame was blocked relating to the child frames.

remarks.para: Each object has the same structure as the parent object â€” this way, any number of levels of embedded <iframe>s can be represented inside the object recursively.

NotRestoredReasonsChildren.value: An array of objects.If the frame has no children, the array will be empty; if the document is in a cross-origin <iframe>, children will return null.

NotRestoredReasonsId.summary:
NOTE Experimental The id read-only property of the
interface returns a string representing the id attribute value of the iframe the document is contained in (for example <iframe id="foo" src="...">).
NotRestoredReasonsId.value: A string.If the document is not in an <iframe> or the <iframe> has no id set, id will return null.

NotRestoredReasonsToJSON.summary: NOTE Experimental The toJSON() method of the interface is a {{Glossary("Serialization","serializer")}}; it returns a JSON representation of the object.
NotRestoredReasonsToJSON.returns: A {{jsxref("JSON")}} object that is the serialization of the object.
